pullRequest.body:
This lemma is ported from to lean4 from Kyle Miller's [repo](https://github.com/kmill/lean-graphs). It is used while proving a lemma about combinatorial maps.

Co-authored-by: Kyle Miller <kmill31415@gmail.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [08ab885005](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16011/commits/08ab8850059f40dba9f7c7256559aa1d993790a3)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ leftInverse_iff`
`+ symm_eq_self_of_involutive`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/3647d3d9-46f7-4a71-a620-9495c101c384) for commit b3bbb14c3f2193e6128531dd57575e21f758ef72.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/2e1b81e2-6e92-4329-9929-1765e1507b31/to/3647d3d9-46f7-4a71-a620-9495c101c384) against commit c138fdc9e6e7aa13d4674aad78db7e2b20147718:
```diff
  Benchmark                                 Metric         Change
  ===============================================================
- ~Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Adjunction.Over   instructions    15.7%
```

Thanks! :tada:
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10541682799/job/29207671950)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10541682799/job/29207671982)
Can you combine these steps to just `rw [h x, symm_comp_self]`? (Is there an explicit lemma for the second step by which you can `rw`?)
I've found something similar, is this okay?
Thanks - looks good. (But please follow Eric's suggestion below, which is even better :-))

It's not clear to me that this should be a `simp` lemma; can you find another example of a simp lemma assuming `Involutive`? We had trouble around this kind of thing long ago, but perhaps the reason is no longer relevant.
I've found similar `simp` lemmas at `Equiv/Basic.lean`, such as `toPerm_symm`. This lemma is still nice to have since `toPerm_symm` isn't exactly what I want, so I will move it to that file.
The simplifier will try to apply `toPerm_symm` only if it has `(h.toPerm f).symm`, while your lemma will match on every `Equiv.symm (e : α ≃ α)`.
Ah, I thought it will check for the involutive condition too, I will remove the simp.
It will match on `Equiv.symm _`, then try to prove `Involutive`.

Could you add this related result:
```lean
theorem Function.Involutive.leftInverse_iff {f g : α → α} (h : Function.Involutive f) :
    Function.LeftInverse g f ↔ g = f :=
  ⟨fun hg => funext fun x => by rw [← h x, hg, h], fun he => he ▸ h.leftInverse⟩
```
which can then be used to prove your result as `h.leftInverse_iff.2 f.left_inv` or similar.
I tried to make `h.leftInverse_iff.2 f.left_inv` work, but I couldn't improve on the version provided in the last commit. In particular, I couldn't write it in term mode (even when using `funext`).

untested:
```suggestion
theorem symm_eq_self_of_involutive (f : Equiv.Perm α) (h : Involutive f) : f.symm = f :=
  DFunLike.coe_injective (h.leftInverse_iff.mp f.left_inv)
```
This one probably belongs next to `Involutive.leftInverse` in an earlier file.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Logic/Equiv): involutions are inverses of themselves
